Job Title: Client Services Manager, Publications

Location: Old Lyme Shores, CT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Client Relations and Brand Management

Create and work to establish meaningful, professional relationships with client stakeholders, including gaining understanding of their individual roles, communication preferences, personal motivators, and the desired outcomes for their projects and our team.Ensure Simpson’s brand is properly represented and promoted throughout client interactions, communications, and deliverables.Collaborate with supervisor to partner with client stakeholders to implement strategies to ensure they are able to attain desired outcomes. Grow to become a trusted partner that client sees as knowledgeable about their business and projects. Collaborate with supervisor to Identify opportunities and flag to Director possible additional services that will assist client in attaining desired outcomes.Attend and ensure success and a positive experience for key client meetings, as directed by supervisor. Support day-to-day activity of Simpson’s publication program across a wide variety of therapeutic areasIncludes day-to-day internal facilitation of external writers, medical Directors, editors, and graphic designersDemonstrate ability to support publications from project inception (kick-off) to final journal submission and publication.Review content developed by writers/authors and, in collaboration with the Director of Publications and Associate Director of Publications, to assess (high-level) medical accuracy, strategic relevance, appropriate tone, and proper format.Understand manuscript submission format and process. Create weekly publication program status documents for both internal and external stakeholders.Support publication update at weekly agency meeting.Create and maintain monthly best practice documents such as our publication database and congress tracker.

Project Management 

Responsible for management of assigned projects ensuring that deliverables meet operational excellence standards (on budget, on time, error-free, on strategy, and within all relevant policies and guidelines). This includes but not limited to: ICMJE, GPP, GRDP, Sunshine Act, and GPP3. Communicate effectively with other Simpson internal teams and third-party vendors regarding expectations, timelines, quality, and budgets.Manage project progress and identify client requests for changes in deliverables, timing, and/or project goals. Communicate all scope changes to Director and then prepare internal CCR, in accordance with process. Adhere to all standard operating procedures (SOPs) and drive internal project team adherence to PIT Crew, Basecamp, CCR, Good to Go, and Weekly client update meetings, sign off SOPs.Develop strong working knowledge of managed products, disease areas, and key communication objectives. Demonstrate an ability to maintain high-quality work while meeting tight deadlines and balancing multiple projects.

Internal Team Communication

Adhere to all SOPs. Contribute to a positive work environment, embrace a team approach, openly communication.Identify and flag to Director potential needed modifications and/or new systems, tools, and processes to enable team and company effectiveness and efficiency.Liaise with Director, other departments, and cross-functional team members to deliver projects as needed inclusive of changes in scope, priority, timing, and/or content.

Other Duties & Responsibilities

Prepare weekly timesheet. Manage and attend relevant internal meetings, as assigned. Other duties as assigned. 

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Needed To Perform This Role

Minimum 1-3 years’ experience in medical communications, healthcare marketing, or scientific agency. Bachelor’s degree required, preferably with emphasis in Marketing, Business, or Science. Strong communicator both in written and verbal forms. Demonstrate a meticulous approach to working and an eye for detail. Appetite and interest for medical publication plan development, management, and execution. Strong interpersonal skills and problem-solving capabilities. Flexibility, positive attitude, strong ability to multitask, and to prioritize projects effectively and communicate at all levels within the company and with our partners and clients. Must be efficient and skilled at using Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word, etc.). Experience with Basecamp or similar project management systems is preferred. Extensive skills with web-conferencing tools such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams and WebEx. Great team player with a strong drive and willingness to take initiative. Curiosity and aptitude for continuous thinking, learning and collaboration.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe

IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding COVID-19 vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status

The potential base pay range for this role, when annualized, is $59,400.00 - $89,200.00. The actual base pay offered may vary based on a number of factors including job-related qualifications such as knowledge, skills, education, and experience; location; and/or schedule (full or part-time). Dependent on the position offered, incentive plans, bonuses, and/or other forms of compensation may be offered, in addition to a range of health and welfare and/or other benefits.

Experience Level (if available): None
